author: Vikas Pathak
text:
At a time when Jawaharlal Nehru University is grappling with a crisis with its students’ union president behind bars after being charged with sedition, one of its professors Vivek Kumar, a sociologist, was caught in an event in the memory of B.R. Ambedkar where a bullet was allegedly fired by protesters outside the venue.

The programme, “An India of Babasaheb’s Dreams in the memory of the Drafting Committee of the Indian Constitution,” was organised in Gwalior on Sunday.

“About 50-60 protesters came to the venue around 2 p.m. They were trying to come in. Police were there. I was delivering a speech there. I was whisked out after the speech and people told me a bullet had been fired,” Prof. Kumar, told The Hindu .

While people at the venue don’t know who the protesters were, they claimed that the agitators shouted the slogan ‘ Bharat Mata Ki Jay ’.
title: Bullet allegedly fired at event on Ambedkar
